dns.eli5: DNS is like the internet's phone book. It helps your computer look up website names.
dns.boss: DNS converts domain names into IP addresses so browsers know where to go.
dns.sysadmin: DNS resolves hostnames to IPs using recursive resolvers and authoritative name servers.
dns.use_case: Used every time you visit a website to resolve the domain name to an IP address.

mqtt.eli5: Imagine walkie-talkies for your smart home devices.
mqtt.boss: MQTT is a lightweight messaging protocol used in IoT to send and receive small data packets.
mqtt.sysadmin: MQTT is a lightweight pub/sub protocol ideal for unreliable networks, frequently used in home automation and industrial IoT.
mqtt.use_case: Used to toggle lights and sensors via platforms like Home Assistant or Hubitat.

api.eli5: APIs let apps talk to each other. Like a waiter between your app and a kitchen.
api.boss: An API allows different software systems to communicate and share data.
api.sysadmin: APIs expose defined endpoints over protocols like HTTP to allow structured data exchange between systems.
api.use_case: Used in every modern app to connect with payment gateways, maps, and services.

dhcp.eli5: DHCP gives your devices their IP address automatically.
dhcp.boss: DHCP automatically assigns IP addresses to devices on a network.
dhcp.sysadmin: Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol leases IP addresses and configuration options from a DHCP server.
dhcp.use_case: Used by routers to assign IPs to home devices.
